_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Continued existence (a definition) [sn12: Existence in the realm of luminous form
Grasping (a definition) [sn12.2:15.6]: Grasping at theories of a self
Feeling (a definition) [sn12.2:15.6]: Feeling born of contact through the eye
Feeling born of contact through the ear
Feeling born of contact through the nose
Feeling born of contact through the tongue
Feeling born of contact through the body
Feeling born of contact through the mind
The six sense fields (a definition) [sn1: The sense field of the eye
The sense field of the ear
The sense field of the nose
The sense field of the tongue
The sense field of the body
The sense field of the mind
Form derived from the four primary elements
Ignorance (a definition) [sn12.2:15.6]: Not knowing about the origin of suffering
Not knowing about the cessation of suffering
Not knowing about the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
